citation.name: Mol. Cell
citation.title: Protein disulfide isomerase A6 controls the decay of IRE1alpha signaling via disulfide-dependent association.

comment.text: Senses unfolded proteins in the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum via its N-terminal domain which leads to enzyme auto-activation (PubMed:9637683, PubMed:11175748, PubMed:12637535). The active endoribonuclease domain splices XBP1 mRNA to generate a new C-terminus, converting it into a potent unfolded-protein response transcriptional activator and triggering growth arrest and apoptosis (PubMed:24508390).
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
The kinase domain is activated by trans-autophosphorylation. Kinase activity is required for activation of the endoribonuclease domain.

Interacts with DAB2IP (via PH domain); the interaction occurs in a ER stress-induced dependent manner and is required for subsequent recruitment of TRAF2 to ERN1 (By similarity). Homodimer; disulfide-linked (PubMed:12637535). Dimer formation is driven by hydrophobic interactions within the N-terminal luminal domains and stabilized by disulfide bridges (PubMed:12637535). In response to ER stress, may form dimers and multimers (PubMed:24508390). Also binds HSPA5, a negative regulator of the unfolded protein response (UPR) (PubMed:12637535). Interacts with PDIA6, a negative regulator of the UPR; the interaction is direct (PubMed:24508390). Both interactions with HSPA5 and PDIA6 may disrupt homodimerization and prevent activation of ERN1 (PubMed:12637535, PubMed:24508390). Interacts with TAOK3 and TRAF2 (PubMed:11278723).
Ubiquitously expressed. High levels observed in pancreatic tissue.
ADP-ribosylated by PARP16 upon ER stress, which increases both kinase and endonuclease activities.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Ser/Thr protein kinase family.

property.value: C:integral component of endoplasmic reticulum membrane
P:activation of signaling protein activity involved in unfolded protein response

feature.description: In a renal clear cell carcinoma sample; somatic mutation.
In a lung adenocarcinoma sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs186305118.
In a gastric adenocarcinoma sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs146710304.
In a glioblastoma multiforme sample; somatic mutation.
In an ovarian serous carcinoma sample; somatic mutation.

No effect on dimerization. Weakens dimer; when associated with S-332. Abolishes interaction with PDIA6. Prolonged splicing of XBP1, probably due to prolonged activation of PDIA6. Inhibits formation of oxidized multimeric forms of ERN1 in response to ER stress.
No effect on dimerization. Weakens dimer; when associated with S-148.
Loss of autophosphorylation and of endoribonuclease activity. Inhibition of growth arrest.
